articles.title: Protocol Signed between DPRK and China
Important Anniversaries of DPRK Marked by Koreans in Germany
articles.content:
Protocol Signed between DPRK and China 
    Beijing, December 23 (KCNA) -- A protocol of the 41st meeting of the inter-governmental committee for cooperation in science and technology between the DPRK and China was signed here today.
 Present at the signing ceremony from the DPRK side were members of the delegation of the Korean State Academy of Sciences and from the Chinese side officials concerned of the Ministry of Science and Technology of China.

articles.title: Dismantlement of "UN Forces Command" Demanded
articles.content:
Important Anniversaries of DPRK Marked by Koreans in Germany 
    Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- The Society for Cooperation among Koreans in Germany held a meeting on Dec. 18 to celebrate the 14th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's assumption of office as supreme commander of the Korean People's Army and the 88th birth anniversary of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk.
 Present there were Chairman Ri Ji Suk and members of the society and the ambassador and staff members of the DPRK embassy in Berlin.
 Speakers at the meeting said that holding Kim Jong Il in high esteem as KPA supreme commander was an expression of the unanimous will of all the Korean people to accomplish the revolutionary cause of President Kim Il Sung generation after generation and their greatest honor.
 They praised Kim Jong Suk as a brilliant model in devotedly defending the leader and a woman general of Mt. Paektu who brought up Kim Jong Il as an iron-willed commander possessed of matchless pluck and grit.    
 They renewed their firm will to work hard for the country's reunification, the behest of the President and the earnest desire of Kim Jong Suk.

articles.title: Foreign Diplomats Visit Art Exhibition
articles.content:
Dismantlement of "UN Forces Command" Demanded 
    Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Anti-U.S. Youth League reportedly demanded the immediate dismantlement of the "UN Forces Command" which exists in name only in an open questionnaire sent to the command on Dec. 19.
 The questionnaire recalled the fact that the command barred members of the Anti-U.S. Youth League from entering Kaesong to participate in the 3rd meeting of representatives of the south and north youth and student organizations for implementing the June 15 joint declaration some days ago and demanded it clarify the proper reason why it did so.    
 The questionnaire queried on what legal ground the command prevented members of the league from entering Kaesong to participate in a function on which an agreement had been reached between the south and the north. This was an act of doing harm to the south-north exchange, it added.

articles.content:
Talks between Delegations of WPK and Democratic Party of Equatorial Guinea Held
    Pyongyang, December 25 (KCNA) -- Talks between the delegation of the Workers' Party of Korea and the delegation of the Democratic Party of Equatorial Guinea were held here today.
 Present there from the DPRK side were Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the WPK Central Committee, and officials concerned and from the Equatorial Guinean side members of the delegation of the Democratic Party of Equatorial Guinea headed by its General Secretary Filiberto Ntutumu Nguema.
 Both sides informed each other of their party activities and exchanged views on developing the friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties and issues of mutual concern.

articles.title: Action Taken by "UN Forces Command" against Youth and Student Representatives under Fire
articles.content:
61st Volume of "Complete Collection of Kim Il Sung's Works" Published
    Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- The Publishing House of the Workers' Party of Korea brought out the 61st volume of the "Complete Collection of Kim Il Sung's Works," a library of the great Juche idea which systematically and comprehensively deals with the famous works of President Kim Il Sung in a chronological order.
 The collection contains 26 works including Kim Il Sung's historic speeches, conclusions and talks from January Juche 66 (1977) to March of the same year.
 Kim Il Sung in a series of works including "On Further Strengthening the People's Power and Giving Proper Guidance to Socialist Law-Abidance" clarified the principled matters arising in further strengthening the people's power and enhancing its function and role.
  Works "On Some Tasks for the League of Socialist Working Youth" and "Talk with Officials of the Central Committee of the League of Socialist Working Youth" indicated the tasks and ways for the organizations of the youth league to train the younger generation to be the reliable successors to the revolutionary cause and competent socialist builders.    
 Some works including "Talk to the Chairman of the Dietmen's League for the Promotion of Japan-Korea Friendship" clarified the consistent stand of the Workers' Party of Korea to achieve the country's reunification and laid down reasonable and just proposals for reunification including the three principles of the country's reunification - independence, peaceful reunification and great national unity- set forth by the WPK.    
 Set out in the book are his outstanding ideas, theories and policies giving perfect answers to the theoretical and practical issues arising in the revolution and construction including the matters of increasing the commanding ability and leadership art of the officials and further developing fisheries in the West Sea.

articles.title: GNP of S. Korea Chiefly to Blame for Illegal Wiretapping
articles.content:
Action Taken by "UN Forces Command" against Youth and Student Representatives under Fire
    Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- The Headquarters of Youth Students of the South Side Committee to Implement the June 15 Joint Declaration reportedly held a press conference in front of the U.S. military base in Ryongsan, Seoul, on Dec. 19 in protest against the action taken by the "UN Forces Command" to bar members of the Anti-U.S. Youth League from entering Kaesong to participate in the meeting of representatives of the north-south youth and student organizations.
 Jon Sang Bong, chairman of the south Korean Council of Youth Organizations, and Jong Thae Hung, chairman of the Anti-U.S. Youth League, in their speeches at the conference said that the "UN Forces Command" blocked the entry of members of the Anti-U.S. Youth League into Kaesong in the wake of the recent reckless remarks made by the U.S. ambassador in Seoul against the north. They charged that this is an expression of the U.S. intention to pressurize the north and further tighten its military domination over south Korea by abusing the name of the "UN Forces Command."
 They termed the action a move to check the reconciliation and cooperation between the south and the north and, furthermore, invent a strong justification to keep the "UN Forces Command" though it exists in name only.

articles.content:
Government Delegation of DPRK Leaves for China
    Pyongyang, December 24 (KCNA) -- A government delegation of the DPRK headed by Ro Tu Chol, vice-premier of the Cabinet, left here Saturday to visit China at the invitation of the government of the People's Republic of China.
 It was seen off at the airport by Rim Kyong Man, minister of Foreign Trade, Kim Yong Il, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and Wu Donghe, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK.

articles.content:
Agreement on Joint Oil Exploitation Inked between DPRK and China
    Beijing, December 24 (KCNA) -- An agreement on joint oil exploitation on the sea was signed between the governments of the DPRK and China through friendly negotiations.
 The signing ceremony took place here today.    
 The agreement was inked by Ro Tu Chol, vice-premier of the Cabinet who is leading the DPRK government delegation on a visit to China, and Zeng Peiyan, vice-premier of the State Council of China.
